snippet: A central figure in Bahrain’s protest movement was sentenced to three months in prison on Monday over a Twitter post about the prime minister that the court said insulted Bahrainis.
abstract: Nabeel Rajab, a central figure in Bahrain’s protest movement, is sentenced to three months in prison over a Twitter post about the prime minister that the court said insulted Bahrainis.
lead_paragraph: A central figure in Bahrain’s protest movement was sentenced to three months in prison on Monday over a Twitter post about the prime minister that the court said insulted Bahrainis.

headline.main: Bahrain: Activist Jailed for Twitter Post
